## Welcome to Year 9 Maths 2026!

This website contains resources, lessons, and materials for our Year 9 Mathematics class. The content is organized according to the New Zealand Mathematics Curriculum.

### Course Overview

In Year 9, we'll explore the following mathematical topics:

- **[Number and Operations](number.qmd)**: Working with integers, fractions, decimals, and percentages
- **[Algebra](algebra.qmd)**: Patterns, equations, and algebraic thinking
- **[Geometry](geometry.qmd)**: Shapes, angles, and geometric properties
- **[Measurement](measurement.qmd)**: Length, area, volume, and units
- **[Statistics](statistics.qmd)**: Data collection, analysis, and interpretation
- **[Probability](probability.qmd)**: Chance, outcomes, and predictions
- **[Ratios and Proportions](ratios.qmd)**: Relationships between quantities

### Learning Goals

By the end of Year 9, you will be able to:

- Apply mathematical concepts to solve real-world problems
- Use mathematical reasoning to justify your solutions
- Communicate your mathematical thinking clearly
- Work collaboratively on mathematical tasks
- Develop confidence in your mathematical abilities

### Getting Started

Click on any topic in the navigation menu to begin exploring the content. Each section includes:

- Key concepts and definitions
- Worked examples
- Practice problems
- Additional resources

### Need Help?

Don't hesitate to ask questions during class or reach out for extra support. Mathematics is a skill that develops with practice and perseverance!
